main.name: Simon Harris
main.subTitle: Software Developer & Solution Architect
main.description: Senior Software Engineer with 12+ years of hands-on experience building and architecting scalable enterprise solutions. I specialize in cloud transformation and distributed systems, with particular expertise in API development and microservice architectures. My approach combines deep technical knowledge with practical problem-solving, consistently delivering robust solutions that drive business value. I maintain an active interest in emerging technologies, particularly in AI-enhanced development workflows, which I've successfully implemented to improve delivery efficiency and code quality.
main.bio: Drawing on over a decade of software engineering experience, I specialize in building cloud-native solutions using .NET technologies and Azure Cloud Services. My experience spans healthcare, maritime insurance, and scientific computing, where I've architected monolith and microservice-based systems that balance technical excellence with practical business needs. I'm passionate about clean code and system design, having led teams in modernizing legacy applications and implementing cloud-first architectures. What drives me is finding elegant solutions to complex technical challenges while ensuring maintainable, high-quality code.
main.contactMessage: Interested in discussing a project or exploring potential collaborations? I'd be delighted to connect with you.

resume.skillMessage: My technical expertise covers a wide range of technologies and methodologies:

education.description: Gained a strong foundation in software development principles, algorithms, and graphics programming. Developed proficiency in C++, Java, and game engine development. The course also included modules on .NET Framework and C#, providing early exposure to Microsoft technologies. Completed projects using C# and XNA Framework, which enhanced my understanding of game development within the .NET ecosystem.

Completed Cisco certifications, gaining valuable knowledge in networking principles and infrastructure, which has proven beneficial in developing distributed systems and cloud-based applications using .NET technologies.

Obtained certification covering various IT aspects, including hardware/equipment installation and customer support. This foundation has been instrumental in understanding system architecture and developing user-centric applications.

work.title: Senior Software Engineer (contract)
work.description: Leading enterprise-scale digital transformation initiatives for maritime insurance, managing systems handling 500+ concurrent users. Architected cloud-native solutions transitioning critical systems to Azure Cloud Services, implemented modern authentication, and established loosely coupled service-oriented architecture. Key projects include modernizing document management systems, migrating legacy applications to .NET 8, and developing sophisticated claims management platforms.

work.title: API Developer (contract)
work.description: Developed complex insurance system APIs for Lloyds of London, enabling real-time document digitization and contract distribution. Architected microservice solutions using containerized Docker instances and MongoDB Atlas, maintaining 80%+ test coverage while implementing comprehensive API documentation and security measures.

work.title: Software Development Manager / Software Developer
work.description: Led the development of global ATS and HCM systems. Managed the delivery of a critical order management system for a major vaccine supplier. Spearheaded an omnichannel capability initiative using Angular and .NET Core. Mentored developers and fostered a culture of technical excellence.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Developed software packages for emergency services and local authorities, including CAD systems and statistical analysis tools. Created a custom routing engine for emergency response optimization using advanced path finding algorithms and data structures.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Developed visualization software for the Compact Muon Solenoid (CMS) experiment. Worked with C++, Python, and OpenGL in a high-performance computing environment, adhering to strict coding standards and peer review processes.
